{"step_by_step_thinking": "Transient diabetes insipidus during pregnancy is often caused by the increased activity of an enzyme called vasopressinase, which is produced in the placenta. Vasopressinase breaks down the hormone vasopressin, also known as antidiuretic hormone (ADH), leading to the symptoms of diabetes insipidus.
